function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Insufficient data on the effectiveness of botanical air filtration under realistic ventilation conditions","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overestimation of indoor plant air purification capabilities based on chamber studies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential microbial growth related to vocs becoming a carbon source for soil microbial communities in plant rhizosphere","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate methods for volatile organic compounds vocs removal from indoor air","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of indoor air quality improvement methods","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitation of not measuring viral aerosol particle size directly.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Viral clumping and associations with suspended proteins may cause variability in viral particle size.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Assumption of linear relationship between uv dose and percent survival","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Effect of relative humidity on uv effectiveness against bacteria and viruses","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent impact of rh on bioaerosol particle size","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consensus on the impact of rh on bioaerosol particle size","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential spread of viruses due to aerosolization and sampling","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effect of relative humidity on uv susceptibility of viral aerosols","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Viral aerosols exhibit higher uv susceptibility at higher rh.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Enveloped viruses like mhv coronavirus are susceptible to inactivation by mechanical stress.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Aerosolization and sampling can lead to survival of infectious viruses, increasing the risk of disease transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in survival rates of viruses in different suspension media can impact disease transmission","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uv susceptibility of viral aerosols varies with different viruses and rh levels, affecting the effectiveness of uv-c disinfection","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uv radiation mapping shows variability in uv exposure levels across the chamber.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Testing the effects of nebulization on the survival of viruses.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential leakage of viral aerosols due to inadequate sealing of chamber parts.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of the experimental chamber by microorganisms due to inadequate filtration or backflow prevention.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential exposure to viral aerosols during chamber maintenance and operation.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Handling of infectious viral samples in the laboratory","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to viral aerosols during experimental procedures","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Improper disposal of viral samples and contaminated materials","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Handling and cultivation of bacteriophage ms2 and e. coli c3000 may pose a risk of accidental exposure and infection.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited data on the effectiveness of uv air disinfection in preventing airborne transmission of viral aerosols such as sars coronavirus.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertain relationship between relative humidity rh and uv inactivation rate of bacterial aerosols.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unknown uv susceptibility of pathogenic viral aerosols under varying relative humidity rh conditions.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential airborne spread of new pathogens such as sars coronavirus and influenza virus","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited data on uvgi inactivation of viral aerosols","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the effectiveness of uvgi on different airborne microorganisms","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of germicidal sources in the built environment during the heating period","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential reactivation of pathogens during air transport after central disinfection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of sars-cov-2, influenza a, and legionella pneumophila transmission through indoor air","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate air exchange leading to high indoor air contamination levels","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of various sources for heat and cold production may increase the risk of cross-contamination and the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Humidification of air using water vapor may create an environment conducive to the growth and spread of airborne pathogens.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of germicidal emitters or sources may lead to the production of harmful by-products or chemicals.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate humidity control in the built environment can promote the growth and spread of airborne pathogens.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient energy consumption in air conditioning operation can lead to poor indoor air quality and ventilation.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate positioning of uv tubes for germicidal sources resulting in ineffective disinfection of ventilation ducts and flowing air.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate calculation of required power input for uv tubes leading to underperformance or excessive energy consumption.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of environmental impact in the selection of energy sources for germicidal treatment.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for optimal performance of the uv-c fluorescent source","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate design of the uv-c system leading to high operating costs","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient consideration of indoor air parameters for different seasons","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of air conditioning ducts with dust and mold due to environmental conditions","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Electrical breakdowns caused by high humidity and condensation affecting fluorescent lamps","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"}]}
